answers.answer: 140/90 is considered to be on the higher side during pregnancy. What has your bp been at your appts? You should definitely call your ob if you're concerned it's higher than normal.

No driving; lay down put a bucket beside ur bed... just in case, and keep hydrated. Drink gatoraid and see if it helps. Sounds like u need hydration. Stay off ur feet and drink a ton of fluids. Hope u feel better!

Its borderline my midwife said if you have vision changes a headache that wont go away with tylenol and stuff to call I ended up with it my last couple wks of pregnancy I gained 10lbs in 2wks which resulted in me being induced at 39wks cause they didnt want me going past that and my protein was high they may just put you on bedrest and see what that does and go from there good luck

I had preeclampsia with my daughter my bp was 104/60 until 38w. It jumped up to 150/100 and I had protein in my urine and bad headaches. I also started gaining 4+ pounds per week  my last two weeks of pregnancy (I delivered at 38+1).
Normally my blood pressure is between 103/60 never higher
And according to the weight gain chart on here ive gained too much should i worry??
I just cheked again and im on 142/89
That's high for pregnancy. Call your doctor

question: Ok, so tomorow ill be 35 weeks but today ive been feelin very unhealthy so to speak, like very nauseas, headackes, dizzy and i look red as a tomato, my face around my nose and cheeks are inflamated, my hands and feet also, i went to cvs pharmacy and i cheked my blood pressure and it was 136/86 is that high? Or low? My family has a history of preclampsya, so please give me advice??
title: My Blood Pressure
